shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Daily Office Prayers and litanies (fols. 5ra-16va) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 16vb-36ra) III) Anaphoras (fols. 36rb-117vb)
Additiones 1-2.

copyists.copyist: Kidanä Maryam is mentioned as the scribe in the supplication formulas, e.g., on fols. 36rb, 44vb, 62ra, 77rb, 96rb.

donors.donor: The name of Kidanä Maryam is written in the main hand in the supplication formulas on fols. 45ra, 55va.

dcomments.dcomment: King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-1889) is mentioned on fols. 12ra, 33vb, 92vb. ʾAbba Sälama (in tenure 1841-68) and ʾabba ʾAtnatewos (in tenure 1869-1876) are mentioned as archbishop (liqä ṗaṗasǝnä) and metropolitan (ṗaṗas) on, e.g., fols. 34ra, 62va, 108rb.

txstates.txstate: The sewing is damaged and repaired, some quires are loose; the leather cover is for the most part missing. Many leaves are worn, badly stained with water, especially in the upper part at the end of the Ms., with the loss of text (e.g., fols. 64v-65r, 92-118). Many leaves are stained with wax and dirt: e.g., fols. 24v, 32r, 62v. Text on many leaves is barely legible or illegible: e.g., fols. 12v, 20v, 29r, 36v, 65r, 95vb. Fols. 60 and 87 have been enlarged by sewing a piece of parchment onto them. Tears amended on fols. 2, 58, 61, 115, 118, 119.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards (the front board covered with reddish-brown tooled leather), remains of textile inlays on both boards. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 3 tools were used: single line fillet, double circle, cross hatching).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, close to the head and to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire: A(4/fols. 1r-4v) – I(8/fols. 5r-12v) – II(8/fols. 13r-20v) – III(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 21r-28v) – IV(8/fols. 29r-36v) – V(8/fols. 37r-44v) – VI(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 5; 6, stub after 2/fols. 45r-52v) – VII(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 53r-61v) – VIII(10/fols. 62r-71v) – IX(8/fols. 72r-79v) – X(8/fols. 80r-87v) – XI(8/fols. 88r-95v) – XII(8/fols. 96r-103v) – XIII(8/fols. 104r-111v) – XIV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 112r-119v).

taunit.rl-info:
Ruling and pricking are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The scribe disregarded the ruled line on fol. 10ra.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: It is possible that more hands were involved in the writing (s., e.g., fols. 44v-45r).

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; name of the scribe; names of the king, archbishop and metropolitan; directives for the ministers or their abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs and of the text dividers; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
Several lines on the incipit page of Texts I and III, alternating with black lines; initial three lines of Text II; incipit of sections of Text I; two or three lines on the incipit page of section of Text III, alternating with black lines.

abbreviations.abbreviation: ካ፡/ይካ፡ for ይቤ፡ ካህን፡ (e.g., fols. 8va, 42vb, 116ra) ሕ፡/ይሕ፡ for ይቤ፡ ሕዝብ፡ (e.g., fols. 11ra, 27rb, 59vb) ዲ፡/ይዲ፡ for ይቤ፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., fols. 42rb, 49rb, 84vb) ቅ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ (e.g., fols. 5ra, 33rb) ጸል፡ for ጸልዩ፡ (e.g., fols. 11vb, 14ra) ቡ፡/ቡራ፡ for ቡራኬ፡ (e.g., fols. 21va, 23va, 113ra) እማ፡/ማ፡ for እማሬ፡ (e.g., fols. 38ra, 55rb, 69va, 103vb) በ፡/በእ፡ for በእንተ፡ (e.g., fols. 11vs, 25ra, 25vb) ይ፡ ሣ፡ እ፡ for ይርከበነ፡ ሣህልከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ (e.g., fols ንበ፡ ኵ፡ for ንበል፡ ኵልነ፡ (e.g., fols. 11rb, 12ra) እ፡ ተ፡ for እግዚኦ፡ ተሣሃለነ፡ (e.g., fol. 11rb) ትእ፡ ንስ፡ ወና፡ for ትእኅዝ፡ ንስእል፡ ወናስተበቍዕ፡ (e.g., 11rb, 11vb) እወ፡ እግ፡ አም፡ አ፡ ዘይ፡ ለ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ ለእ፡ ወመ፡ ኢ፡ ክ፡ for እወድሰከ፡ እግዚኦ፡ አምላክነ፡ አኃዜ፡ ኵሉ፡ ዘይነግሥ፡ ለኵሉ፡ ዓለም፡ አቡሁ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ወመድኃኒነ፡ ኢየሱስ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ (e.g., fols. 14ra, 15va-b) ቅ፡ እ፡ ቅ፡ ኃ፡ ቅ፡ ሕ፡ ዘኢ፡ for ቅዱስ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ቅዱስ፡ ኃይል፡ ቅዱስ፡ ሕያው፡ ዘኤይመውት፡ (fol. 30rb) ለዓ፡ ዓ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ (fol. 69vb) ህ፡ ው፡ በህ፡ for ህልው፡ ውእቱ፡ በህላዊሁ፡ (fols. 73ra, 73rb) ለዓ፡ ዓለም፡ አ፡ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 77rb) ወለ፡ ዓ፡ አ፡ for ወለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ (fol. 117vb) ለይ፡ for ለይኩን፡ (fol. 90ra) ሆ፡ ሆ፡ ሆ፡ for ሆሳዕና፡ ሆሳዕና፡ ሆሳዕና፡ (fol. 108rb).

additional.cont: Fol. 118va: Unclear note (list of the church feasts?).
additional.det: The note is crudely written and mentions several feasts. It is possibly a pen trial.

additional.cont: Fol. 118vb: Unclear note.
additional.det: The note is crudely written. The text is identical to that of Additio 1. It is possibly a pen trial.

extras.extra: - The scribe used compressed script on fols. 16vb, 20rb. - Tämälläs-sign, in the shape of two perpendicular lines (┴), indicating the place where the omission, written in the upper margin, belongs: fol. 62va. - Omitted letters or words inserted interlineally: e.g., fols. 9ra, 20rb, 43vb, 71ra, 98ra. - Omitted words added at the beginning of the line in small script: e.g., fols. 7vb, 11va, 13va. - Omitted words added at the end of the line in small script: e.g., fols. 9ra, 16ra, 54ra. - Omitted sentences written in small script in the lower margin: fol. 50vb. - Corrections over erasure: fols. 68rb, 106ra (here in a secondary hand). - Immediate corrections indicated by series of dashes above and below the letters: e.g., fols. 9ra, 13rb, 26rb, 68va, 111rb. - Lacunae (spaces for names left unfilled): e.g., fols. 36rb, 48ra, 72vb, 96rb. - Small crosses at the left margin of the column: e.g., fols. 51va, 58rb, 80va, 104rb. - Directives for ministers are crudely written in blue ink in the upper margin on fols. 84va and 115r. - Pen trial: fols. 1r, 3v, 4v. - Scribbles in pencil: e.g., fols. 24, 118r. - Crude drawings in blue ink and pen on fols. 1r, 2r, 3r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Readings of Texts III are indicated by the names of the feasts written in the upper margin in red ink, possibly in the main hand. Almost all readings are barely legible due to faded ink: ዘዮሐንስ፡ ወሰማዕት፡ ለፍሬ፡ …: fol. 48ra በጸሎተ፡ ሐሙስ፡ ወበክረምት፡ fol. 55va በመዋለ፡ ጰጠቈስቴ፡ … fol. 71ra (poorly legible) fol. 77rb ዘሆሣዕና፡ አምረቡዕ፡ … fol. 105vb ዘሙታን፡ fol. 109vb. - Threads have been inserted in the upper corner of fols. 35, 39, 48, 55.
